text: [Music]
I'm Raj agal CEO of localytics
localytics is an analytics provider for
mobile applications we help the
developers of iOS Android Blackberry
Windows Phone 7 and other smartphone and
tablet apps better understand their
users so they can make smar decisions
and build more successful and profitable
applications so we give developers
powerful tools to really understand
their users and where people people are
running into problems for example funnel
analysis to help them understand where
users are dropping off engagement tools
to understand who your most valuable
users are and what you need to do to
keep them on board so an app developer
want to use us because we provide a much
deeper level of insight on their users
so they can actually understand who it
is that they're marketing to and what it
takes to get them to convert we're
working with many thousands of
applications including some of the top
companies uh you know in the in the
space in for example the New York Times
The Wall Street Journal um and many
others we help the Publishers of apps uh
understand for example where in their
funnel they're losing their users um how
people are navigating through their app
to find the weak points uh in the
application so you can um improve the
application experience local ltic uh
uses AWS because it provides the the
flexibility and the scalability that
we've needed as a startup as well as as
a rapidly growing business we've been
using AWS from the very beginning uh
rails application is running on ec2
backed by evbs we're talking to a number
of databases also running on ec2 a lot
of column store databases we're using
mongod DB we're using a little bit of
sdb uh the back end is a full realtime
pipeline built in Scala we receive
requests from our AA framework we are
using a number of AWS services to help
move the data around such as sqs to get
the events moved back and forth very
quickly between cers and our processor
we're using the elastic features of ec2
to bring up processors and databases as
demand moves and goes along with the
market uh on the back end we're storing
all of our data in S3 and we're using
EMR to do Hadoop map produce jobs on top
of it to get the answers back as quickly
as we can local litics entered the AWS
startup challenge because Amazon web
service has been a critical part of our
business from the beginning and we
wanted to illustrate how creatively uh
and innovatively we're using AWS across
cross our entire stack
